column4: um, I just upgraded from dapper to edgy... now I have 2 problems. Whenver I start a terminal I get 'To run a command as administrator (user root), use sudo <command>.' ... quite annoying. Any idea how to turn that off
the other issue is that every time I login I get the mail-notification popup
must be in your .bashrc file or perhaps the system bashrc
the other one is the mail-notificaton popup... if I start gnome-session-properties then I see 'mail-notification --sm-disable' in the startup programs... and I can't seem to remove it
i know feisty fawn now is like sid, but is there a constant sid that you dont need to change your sources lines?
that s the same as running gnome-session-properties... trying to just disable it brb
